cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of Key West, Florida and 25 miles NW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west across the Florida Straits tonight, then turning WNW–NW into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Monday–Tuesday and forecast to curve NE toward Florida’s Big Bend and the southeast U.S. coast late Wednesday–Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key / Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, southeastern Gulf of Mexico, Florida Big Bend, and later the coasts of GA–SC–NC
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with a low (≤9%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts in squalls possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Miami coastline with the system remaining in the Gulf of Mexico.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–4 inches of rain with isolated amounts up to 6 inches possible through Wednesday, creating a risk of urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas and rip currents for vessels entering/exiting Government Cut; localized street flooding during peak downpours.
